neutron_diagnostic.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

neutron_diagnostic.code.library[:].param.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

neutron_diagnostic.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

neutron_diagnostic.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

Raw amplitude of the measured signal

neutron_diagnostic.detectors[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.
Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"
Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"
Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data
Index in the error_description list for "surface"

Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

neutron_diagnostic.detectors[:].field_of.documentation: Field of view associated to this detector. The field of view is described by a voxelized plasma volume. Each voxel, with indexes i_R, i_Z, and i_phi, has an associated solid angle scalar and a detector direction vector.

Vector that points from the centre of the voxel to the centre of the detector, described in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis.
Components along X axis for each voxel
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Component along Y axis  for each voxel
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Component along Z axis  for each voxel
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Grid defining the neutron emission cells in the plasma
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Average solid angle that the detector covers within the voxel
Index in the error_description list for "solid_angle"

neutron_diagnostic.detectors[:].green_fu.documentation: Green function coefficients used to represent the detector response based on its field of view

5th dimension for the Green functions representing values of events measured in the detector.The type of events monitored depends on the detector and can be defined by the user. It can be energy of neutrons, or electrical signal, or TOF (defined by type below)

Type of the event
1) energy_neutron : Neutron energy in the detector [eV]
2) voltage : Voltage in the detector [V]
3) time_of_flight : Time of flight [s]
4) trajectory_length : Particle trajectory length [m]
5) energy_deposited : Deposited energy [eV]
6) light_yield : Light yield [eVee]
Verbose description
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Short string identifier
Array of values for the event
Index in the error_description list for "values"
Lower error for "values"
Upper error for "values"
Grouped neutron flux in the detector from one neutron energy bin emitted by the current plasma voxel towards the detector
Index in the error_description list for "neutron_flux"
Lower error for "neutron_flux"
Upper error for "neutron_flux"
Number of events occurring in the detector from one neutron energy bin emitted by the current plasma voxel towards the detector
Index in the error_description list for "response_function"
Lower error for "response_function"
Upper error for "response_function"
Array of source neutron energy bins
Index in the error_description list for "source_neutron_energies"
Lower error for "source_neutron_energies"
Upper error for "source_neutron_energies"

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.commen.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.creati.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.homoge.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.occurr.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.proven.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documentatiing provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.provid.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

neutron_diagnostic.ids_properties.versio.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS
